nodes.text: "Poe Dameron's theme" was composed and conducted by John Williams for the 2015 film Star Wars: Episode VII The Force Awakens. A full statement of the theme appears in the track "I Can Fly Anything," and the musical score functions as the leitmotif for Poe Dameron, one of the central characters of the sequel trilogy.

The track first plays when Dameron and Finn escape from the Resurgent-class Star Destroyer Finalizer at the beginning of The Force Awakens. Dameron's leitmotif plays again when Finn witnesses his piloting at the Battle of Takodana, and at the end of the film, in "Farewell and the Trip," when the Resistance escapes from the destruction of Starkiller Base. A version of the motif plays during the end credits suite, paired with the chase motif representing Finn.
